column4: has anyone had problems with flash being out of sync with audio? the video is behind the audio for me
I just installed edgy
remove flashplugin-nonfree and use the flash 9 beta
put the lib in ~/.mozilla/plugins/
make sure you remove the flashplugin-nonfree package, then restart ff
when I try to play flash in mozilla, it's saying flash ain't installed.
well, did you move the plugin to the correct location?
sudo cp flash-player-plugin-9.0.21.55/libflashplayer.so ~/.mozilla/plugins
don't use sudo
cp: accessing `/home/shawn/.mozilla/plugins/': Not a directory
so create it.
mkdir: cannot create directory `/home/shawn/.mozilla/plugins/': File exists
and when I browse there with gnome, there is a plugins file with a padlock icon on it
sudo chown -R $USER ~/.mozilla
what does chown do?
should I just try to delete that file?
no
I still can't copy to it, or make the directory
sorry if I'm being annoying, but I'm a total noob for linux
did you chown ~/.mozilla/plugins/ ?
yes and the padlock icon went away, but it is still a file, not a folder
rm ~/.mozilla/plugins && mkdir ~/.mozilla/plugins
thanks a lot man, it works great now!
do you know of any speech recognition software for linux?
